Я уверен вы понимаете. Хорошая задумка с одной стороны, и убогая реализация с другой. Интересный концепт с неплохо продуманными механиками с одной стороны и ужасная забагованная дисбалансная реализация с другой. Наличие достаточно объемного количества контента и абсолютно подавляющая его бесполезность. Возможность играть вместе с друзьями, с рандомами, в соло, но исключительно в покалеченном матчмейкинге. Наконец-то громадное комьюнити объединенное этой игрой, которое изрыгает на вас свою токсичность при любом удобном случае. Играть в ДБД - это как сесть голой задницей в костер. С одной стороны это непередоваемые ощущения, но с другой это то, что даже врагу не пожелаешь.

Sokan azt hiszik, hogy egy idő után unalmas lesz. Na ez nem igaz. A játékmenet ugyan az, de a kijutás megvalósítása lehet több fajta is. Személy szerint, én a gyilkossal szoktam fogocskázni, amíg a társaim megcsinálják a generátorokat. Többet funabb, de ha nincs kivel játszani, ott a gyilkos szerep is. ez kicsit nehezebb, de ez is helyt állt nálam. Csak ajánlani tudom! :)

Un jeu 4 contre 1 pas bien compliqué à prendre en main, bien qu'il vous faudra quelques parties afin de bien en profité. Ce jeu se révèle être une addiction pour moi, et ce n'est pas pour rien, il est amusant, satisfaisant lorsqu'on gagne, frustrant qu'on perd. Si je devais mettre des mauvais points c'est que la communauté peut-être très salé (et des fois des anges), et bon ça manque un petit peu de frissons mais sinon très bon et je pense que les devs did a pretty good job so far...
Nice game для кооператива, хоть и всевозможные лаги с toxic ребятами в сложившемся community доставляют)))0

[h1]Dead By Daylight is a game that's really hard to pin down.[/h1]

The game is a quote unquote "asymmetrical multiplayer survival horror-game." While that of course is true, after hundreds of hours of playtime, it has turned into more of a competitive 1v4/4v1 multiplayer game for me, where 2 parties try to outmaneuver the other for approximately 20 mins per match. So if you're looking for a "true horror experience" - try not to immerse too much into the skill-based aspect that comes with the game, and don't pay too much attention to the rank system, seeing as how the better you get at the game and the more you understand it, the less scary it becomes. 

Now with that being said, let's get into The Good, The Bad and The Ugly.

[h1]The Good[/h1]

-Each match plays out differently, since maps are chosen at random, structures are generated at random and since players have the option to use certain "offerings" that can influence specific elements of the match. (I.E what map will be chosen, adding another loot-able chest or if the sacrificial hooks will be spawned closer together etc.) These offerings can sometimes even make the difference between a win or a loss, depending on which role you're playing of course. (Survivor/Killer)

-There are a ton of characters to choose from for both roles. Each single one of them coming with their own individual perks, allowing the player to choose which perks of which characters fit their playstyle the best. On that topic:

-There are infinite possibilities when it comes to perk builds. After reaching specific levels on any character, the player will unlock said character's individual perks for all other characters that are the same role. You can mix and match whichever perks you'd like and come up with your own perk build that works best for you. Of course you can also experiment and come up with specific builds that fit the playstyle you'll be going for during that match the most. (i.e a stealth build, a confrontational build, etc)

-You can acquire cosmetics to customize your characters, giving them a more personal touch, and giving the player the opportunity to express their style. You'll be able to do this with in-game currency, but also through microtransactions. (These do not serve any other purpose other than to simply change your appearance in-game.) 

-There is a huge skill-ceiling, making it so that the player gets the opportunity the improve their skills and play the game competitively if they feel like it.

-The soundtrack is very memorable and immersive. The background music that plays as a killer whenever you're not in a chase and trying to hunt down the survivors really makes you feel like you're on a mission to rule them all out. And the chase music as both roles makes for an adrenaline inducing experience, not knowing if you'll either catch the survivor as a killer, and win the chase as a survivor. (However, the chase music does get a bit repetitive when you play the game for hundreds of hours since there are only a select few of tracks that randomly play.)

-The developer team works hard to bring content throughout the entire year by adding new things like cosmetics every once in a while, new chapters every few months that include a new map/characters/perks and by trying to balance out and change maps, perks and certain game mechanics for both roles.

-The new tome and rift system makes for a that much more enjoyable grind since you get rewards for completing challenges that can range from in-game currencies to exclusive cosmetics

-Lots and lots of replay value. (i.e you can always try to reach prestige 3 on all the available characters and the newly added characters to keep yourself busy, and many more things.)

[i]Now as much as I like playing Dead By Daylight and I'd like to recommend it to others, I also have to get into the bad aspects of the game.[/i]

[h1]The Bad[/h1]

-Hit registration is simply unfair at times and still it feels like it's in an unfinished state. As much as the devs try to fix it, survivors still get hit at times where they clearly shouldn't. [b]Especially when vaulting windows.[/b] Not only that, but sometimes killers are supposed to hit a survivor and it either doesn't register (i.e when using The Hillbilly's chainsaw), or they get screwed over by auto-aim, which doesn't happen too often, but when it does - it could eventually lead to a drastic change when it comes to the outcome of a chase.

-With every update, new bugs are introduced. Some of them aren't truly disruptive, such as weird animations or seeing certain textures glitch out, but other ones are game-breaking that either cause unbalance or [b]literally[/b] ruin the game overall. (i.e the old Legion exploit that caused the mend timer to become infinite.) The devs try to be as quick as possible with fixing these issues but sometimes they're simply not fast enough. 

-Now you might say I'm being a little nit-picky here, but I still think this is something that is meant to be taken seriously. There are still perks in the game that were added back in 2016 (or later) that are very under-powered and don't really serve a purpose. Yet, instead of these perks getting reworks or buffs, they've simply been neglected for years now and nobody really talks about them anymore. I can guarantee that the pick-rate of some of these perks is literally below 5%. (i.e Deja Vu, Vigil, Calm Spirit, Sole Survivor, Monstrous Shrine etc.)

-Sometimes you get matched up with people that aren't anywhere near the same rank bracket you're in.

[b]Now let's get into The Ugly.[/b]

[h1]The Ugly[/h1]

[i]Now don't immediately click off the review, but the worst thing about the game when it comes to it, is [b]the community.[/b][/i] 

[b]Please note that it's not necessarily the case that you'll see people pull this type of behavior every single match that you play, but from time to time these things will occur, and when they do, it's [u]very[/u] annoying for whoever is affected by said things.[/b]

-Certain people in the community take pride in deliberately ruining the game for others by playing in a toxic manner. Things like this include but are not limited to: 
[i]As killer:[/i] Face Camping, Hard-Tunneling or purposely letting a Survivor bleed out on the floor when they have no reason to, maybe even T-bagging them in the process if the killer has that ability.
[i]As survivor:[/i] Chain-Blinding, T-Bagging, Pointing or Waving at the killer at dropped pallets/exit gates or waiting at the exit gate just to run out in front of the killer.

-The post-game chat is one of the best features in the game. That is, when it's used for it's intended purpose, to *normally* talk to the other players in the match and perhaps discuss events that took place during the match. Many friends are made with this feature, and it makes for a more fun experience overall. 
[i]The problem is:[/i] A lot of people use the post-game chat to harass the other players and insult them - sometimes even threaten them. All over a match of Dead By Daylight. Now of course we're all on the internet and this is something a lot of people have gotten used to over the years, but some people don't really have thick skin and can genuinely feel hurt because of these people. If you do play this game, expect to get a barrage of insults thrown at you when something doesn't go these toxic people's way.

[h1]TL;DR & Conclusion[/h1]

I recommend Dead By Daylight to anyone who likes a team-based (horror) multiplayer game or an asymmetrical and competitive 1v4 experience. There's so much to the game, so much to learn, unlock and grind for, that it makes it a very worthwhile experience in my opinion. 

Final score: 7.8/10 - It's a great game, but not perfect. It would be much higher if the aforementioned issues were sorted out, but other than that: [i]"A pretty good job so far."[/i]
